Why did Prospero create the storm? (Variant 51)
questions.answer: To bring his enemies to the island.

questions.question: Why did Miranda pity the sailors? (Variant 52)
Why is Ariel important? (Variant 53)
How did Antonio harm Prospero? (Variant 54)
Why does Prospero forgive? (Variant 55)
How does love change Ferdinand? (Variant 56)
questions.answer: It teaches him humility and duty.

questions.question: Why does Caliban resist? (Variant 57)
What magic power does Prospero use? (Variant 58)
Why is the ending hopeful? (Variant 59)
How does the play show justice? (Variant 60)
questions.answer: Wrongdoers admit guilt and are pardoned.

questions.question: Explain Prospero’s journey from betrayal to forgiveness. (Insight 151)
questions.answer: Betrayed by Antonio, Prospero uses wisdom and magic but ends showing mercy and reclaiming dignity.

questions.question: Describe Ariel’s role in restoring justice. (Insight 152)
questions.answer: Ariel guides events, protects the innocent and forces villains to face their actions.

questions.question: How does love between Miranda and Ferdinand support the theme? (Insight 153)
questions.answer: Their honest love contrasts with the selfishness of the past and promises renewal.

questions.question: Why is Caliban both tragic and dangerous? (Insight 154)
questions.answer: Caliban suffers under Prospero yet chooses violence, making him mixed and conflicted.

questions.question: What message about power and mercy does the play offer readers? (Insight 155)
questions.answer: True strength lies in forgiveness and responsible leadership rather than revenge.
